Under section DATE of LAW , the grounds enumerated in section CARDINAL subsections CARDINAL - CARDINAL are considered absolute grounds for the judge concerned to be automatically disqualified from sitting in the case . Subsection CARDINAL concerns situations in which a judge is obliged to inform the president of his court of any circumstances which might cast doubt on his or her impartiality . The president of the court must then , in view of the circumstances of the given case , make a decision regarding the possible disqualification of the judge .
